Authors:
Siska Arie Siahaan, Kartini Kramadibrata, Iman Hidayat,
Jamjan Meeboon, Susumu Takamatsu
Title:
Erysiphe baliensis and E. sidae, two new species of
anamorphic Erysiphe (powdery mildew) from Indonesia
Keywords:
Erysiphaceae, Gliricidia sepium, Pseudoidium, Sida
rhombifolia, Wisteria japonica
Abstract:
Two new anamorphic species belonging to the genus
Erysiphe, viz.Â E. baliensis and E. sidae, are described in this study.
Erysiphe baliensis is found on Gliricidia sepium in Bali, Indonesia, and
on Wisteria japonica (syn. Millettia japonica) in Japan. Internal
transcribed spacer sequences and anamorph of the collections on the two
plant genera collected in Indonesia and Japan were identical to each
other and considered to be con-specific. Erysiphe sidae found on Sida
rhombifolia is an isolated species in the genus Erysiphe based on
molecular phylogeny.
